alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 7:31AM EST until December 23 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston, and from Edwardsport to Hazleton. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches from Friday night into Saturday caused minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. The crest on the White River is nearing Edwardsport with points downstream steady to slowly rising. The crest on the East Fork White River is near Seymour with flooding expected to end by late Tuesday. Flooding along the White River is expected to last into Thursday for points downstream of Newberry. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Flooding closes Old Vincennes Road. High water crosses SR 358 on the Daviess County side just west of the levee. Flooding begins to affect higher bottomlands. Residential property of river cabins begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EST Monday /12:00 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM EST Monday /12:00 AM CST Monday/ was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later this morning.
